cont.entity_a: Expensive but comparable to similar models.

Ergonomic design reduces discomfort and increases typing speed and accuracy. Beautiful form and great keyswitches. Frame could be sturdier to reduce noise while typing. The placement of some keys is awkward, such as the Ctrl key.
cont.entity_b: Wireless keyboard is convenient for travel. Keys are smaller and numbers not in standard positions. PDA holder has flimsy support arms. Some layout aspects and IR port design are poor. Adjustable arms are flimsy, making alignment difficult.

cont.entity_a: Programmable keys allow customization. No empty mechanical button available for macro assignment.
cont.entity_b: Wireless keyboard eliminates the need for a stylus. Mouse option available.

cont.entity_a: Durable, with some units lasting many years.
cont.entity_b: Short battery life requires carrying extra batteries. Keyboard randomly stopped working occasionally. Received item was used, not new as advertised.

cont.entity_a: Lack of Mac OSX drivers for certain keys.
cont.entity_b: Compatible with PSP 1000 with custom firmware. Issues with battery life on Tungsten C after driver installation. Compatible with some PDAs but not with Tungsten T3. Not compatible with some PDA models despite claims.

cont.entity_a: Requires an adjustment period to get used to the layout, but faster typing once accustomed. High learning curve but worth it.
cont.entity_b: 20% of keystrokes not registered on Treo 270. Clicks loudly, disturbing others in meetings.

cont.entity_a: Helps with wrist problems and reduces strain. Thumb keys are beneficial for reducing pinky strain.
The Esc, F-keys, and programmable buttons are small, not mechanical, and prone to breaking.

cont.entity_b: Awkward connection but functions with Palm TX. Infrared option is cheaper than Bluetooth.
Short battery life requires carrying extra batteries.
Requires driver download for better performance.
